title: Linked Identifier
description: An attestation where the attester (a trusted third party) asserts that the subject controls the linked identifier, effectively attesting that two identities are owned by the same entity.

@context.description: Optional JSON-LD context URI for semantic processing.

attester.title: Attester ID
attester.description: DID of the third-party entity making the assertion. This entity has verified the linkage between the subject and linkedId.

subject.title: Subject ID
subject.description: DID of the subject (such as did:pkh for wallet addresses or did:web for web domains) that is claimed to control the linked identifier.

linkedId.title: Linked Identifier
linkedId.description: The identifier being claimed as controlled by the subject (e.g., a did:web, email address, or domain).

linkedIdType.title: Linked ID Type
linkedIdType.description: Type or namespace of the linkedId being asserted. Examples: did:web (for websites), did:key (for keys), email, twitter, github, facebook, discord, telegram, lens, farcaster, or any other well-known identifier type.

method.title: Verification Method
method.description: Verification method used by the attester to confirm the subject's control of the linkedId.

issuedAt.title: Issued Date
issuedAt.description: Timestamp when the attestation was issued.

validUntil.title: Valid Until
validUntil.description: Optional expiration timestamp after which the attestation is no longer considered valid.

attestationType.title: Attestation Type
attestationType.description: Optional classification of the attestation for filtering and indexing purposes.
